Member Documentation

QPair< QString, QList< QVariant > > DeserializedData




virtual ~QxtAbstractSignalSerializer ( )




virtual QByteArray serialize ( const QString & fn , const QVariant & p1 = QVariant() , const QVariant & p2 = QVariant() , const QVariant & p3 = QVariant() , const QVariant & p4 = QVariant() , const QVariant & p5 = QVariant() , const QVariant & p6 = QVariant() , const QVariant & p7 = QVariant() , const QVariant & p8 = QVariant() ) const =0

Serializes a signal into a form suitable for sending to an I/O device.




virtual DeserializedData deserialize ( QByteArray & data ) =0

Deserializes binary data into a signal name and a list of parameters. When implementing this function, be sure to remove the processed portion of the data from the reference parameter. Return QxtAbstractSignalSerializer::NoOp() if the deserialized data does not invoke a signal. Return QxtAbstractSignalSerializer::ProtocolError() if the protocol has been violated and the connection should be severed.




virtual bool canDeserialize ( const QByteArray & buffer ) const =0

Indicates whether the data currently in the buffer can be deserialized.




DeserializedData NoOp ( ) static

Returns an object that indicates that the deserialized data does not invoke a signal.




DeserializedData ProtocolError ( ) static

Returns an object that indicates that the deserialized data indicates a fatal protocol error.




bool isNoOp ( const DeserializedData & value ) static

Checks to see if the provided object does not invoke a signal.




bool isProtocolError ( const DeserializedData & value ) static

Checks to see if the provided object indicates a fatal protocol error.
